intro: Dichotomanthes tristaniicarpa var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth-fruited dichotomanthes, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asphodelaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green to yellow in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and the species is noted for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soils. It is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
